newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian cotton prices rise, daily arrivals fall.
newsitem.headline: Indian cotton prices rise, daily arrivals fall.

text.p: Indian cotton prices on Friday rose on fresh mill buying mainly from the spinning mills and on lower arrivals, dealers said.
Daily average arrivals of cotton in the Punjab region dropped to 800/1,000 bales (170 kg each) against the earlier average of 1,000/1,500 bales.

In spot deals Punjab saw-ginned rose by 25/50 rupees at 1,675/1,750 rupees per maund (37.32 kg) while F-414 lifted by 35/40 rupees at 1,980/2,000 rupees per maund and Bengal-deshi rose by 10 rupees at 935/975 rupees per maund.
"Indian cotton yarn manufacturers are witnessing higher overseas demand which in turn prompted increased buying for raw cotton by the spinning mills," one trader said.

Gujarat varieties too lifted further amid limited arrivals and shortage of superior varieties. In the spot deals Gujarat Kalyan rose by 100 rupees to 14,000/14,600 rupees per candy (355.56 kg) while wagad cotton rose by 50 rupees at 12,900 rupees per candy.
Sentiments at the close remained firm on market talk that the Indian government may soon allow forward trading in the cotton. -- Bombay Commodities +91-22-265 9000
